meanings.definition: To lower in rank or position.
meanings.sent1: She was demoted to a lower position at work.
meanings.sent2: The manager demoted the employee for not following company rules.
meanings.sent3: After mixing up the files, she was demoted to the file room.
meanings.sent4: His mistake demoted him from team leader to a regular member.
meanings.sent5: The demotion left her feeling disappointed and undervalued.

meanings.definition: To reduce to a lower grade or rank.
meanings.sent1: The teacher demoted the student to a lower grade due to poor performance.
meanings.sent2: He was demoted from captain to lieutenant in the army.
meanings.sent3: The demoted player had to sit on the bench for the entire game.
meanings.sent4: Her demotion in the company hierarchy was a blow to her ego.
meanings.sent5: Being demoted made him realize he needed to work harder to improve.

meanings.definition: To relegate to a lower rank or position.
meanings.sent1: The coach demoted the star player to the second string.
meanings.sent2: She felt embarrassed when she was demoted to assistant manager.
meanings.sent3: The demoted employee joked that they were now the 'assistant to the assistant'.
meanings.sent4: His demotion to a lower position was a wake-up call for him to improve.
meanings.sent5: The demoted worker vowed to prove themselves and climb back up the ranks.
